intro: Dryadella misasii, commonly known as the Philippine dryadella, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its leaves are usually ovate and glossy, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
